Package org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Citation
    A Citation node represents a pointer from the digital system to the physical world.
    Claim
    The Claim class is merely a placeholder to represent those kinds of nodes that represent claims made by a source.
    Connection
    A Connection embodies directed relationships between two other claims.
    ExternalSource
    ExternalSource is the most commonly discussed type of Source, originating from the real world.
    Grouping
    A Grouping embodies undirected relationships between two or more other claims.
    Inference
    An Inference is a source that is derived through reasoning (represented by an InferenceRule) that is supported by other Claim nodes, rather than an external witness.
    InferenceRule
    Inference rules describe how to derive new claims based on existing claims.
    Match
    Each Thing node represents the claim a source might make that "something exists".
    Note
    Note nodes are generic human-targeted information that can be attached to any other node.
    Property
    A Property represents a single putative fact we might encounter or derive about some other claim.
    Source
    The Source class is merely a placeholder to represent those kinds of nodes that can be the source of a Claim.
    Thing
    Each Thing node represents the claim a source might make that "something exists".
